wikipedia_page.main: Dr James Sheridan Muspratt FRSE FRSD (8 March 1821 – 3 February 1871) was an Irish-born research chemist and teacher. His most influential publication was his two-volume book Chemistry, Theoretical, Practical and Analytical as applied and relating to the Arts and Manufactures (1857–1860).

response: Later in 1848, Susan married James Sheridan Muspratt, and retired from the stage, living in Liverpool until her death in 1859, aged 37. The couple had three children.
* 8 March – James Sheridan Muspratt, Irish-born research chemist and teacher (died 1871)
*8 March – James Sheridan Muspratt, research chemist and teacher (died 1871).
*3 February – James Sheridan Muspratt, research chemist and teacher (born 1821).
*James Sheridan Muspratt, who moved into academic chemistry

In 1848, there was a convergence of financial need, the "small fortune" Hays received was lost due to her father's depleted financial situation, and Charlotte Cushman's sister was leaving the stage, which created an acting opportunities. Charlotte's sister, Susan Webb Cushman, who played Juliet to Charlotte's Romeo, left the stage to marry a successful Liverpool scientist, James Sheridan Muspratt.
